lines.gurmukhi: haumY AiBmwn AsQwn qij bMJ bn crn kml gur sMpt smwie hY
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Abhimaan Asadaan Taji Banjh Bana , Charan Kamal Gur Sanpat Samaai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The black bee like mind of a Guru-oriented person who is attached with the congregation of saintly persons, forsakes pride and ego which is like a jungle of bamboos. He leaves attachment and infatuations. Enamoured by the lotus-like feet of the True Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: Aiq hI AnUp rUp hyrq ihrwny diRg Anhd guMjq s√çn hU isrwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ati Hee Anoop Roop Hayrat Hiraanay Driga , Anahad Gounjat Sravan Hoo Siraaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the most beautiful form of the True Guru, his eyes are amazed. Listening to the pleasing and enchanting notes of the words of Guru, his ears feel calm and tranquil.

lines.gurmukhi: rsnw ibsm Aiq mDu mkrMd rs nwiskw ckq hI subwsu mhkwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Rasanaa Bisam Ati Madhu Makarand Rasa , Naasikaa Chakat Hee Soubaasu Mahakaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Relishing the sweet elixir-like dust of the feet of the True Guru, the tongue enjoys strange bliss and pleasure. The nostrils are amazed by the sweet smell of that dust of the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: komlqw sIqlqw pMg srbMg Bey mn mDukr puin Anq nw Dwey hY ]335]
lines.transliteration_english: Komalataa Seetalataa Pang Sarabang Bhaay , Man Madhoukar Pouni Anat Naa Dhaaay Hai ?335?

Shabad OS B.translation: Experiencing the calmness and tenderness of the sweet smell of the holy feet of the True Guru, all limbs of the body become stable. The black bee like mind then does not wander anywhere else and remains attached with lotus-like feet. (335)
